title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: He was just at Ballocliraggan, when he heard a shout behind him, and, looking back, he saw a farmer's gig coming up rapidly, and recognised Donald Stewart, the farmer in Dalieoch on the Findowie side of the Braan.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: The old house of Findowie, now a ruin, was said to be filled with curious recesses and hidden rooms, and even to have underground  passages below the bed of the Braan, in which the old Laird of Findowie had hidden in the dark days after Culloden, but there was no mystery of romance or intrigue about Dalmore.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: He saw the trouts leaping in the gleaming pools in the Braan, which were shaded by the drooping birch trees and the golden tassels of the larches, and his young heart leaped too, for the world was a lovely world, and life was all before him.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: He had walked round by the road and across the Amulree Bridge, the night being too dark for him to cross the Braan by the stepping-stones.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: She saw Fergus, with Colin at his heels, already crossing the Braan by the stepping-stones he had rolled down himself before the Lodge to make a quick cut to Dalmore.
